editorialNotes.standard: Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and soundand a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, its surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Decide the fate of your kingdom
editorialNotes.standard: This game absolutely floored us. It seems straightforward at firstyoure a king, and youre presented with choices about how to rule as a deck of cards. Swipe right to choose one path, swipe left for another. But theres so very much more going on, and without spoiling anything, Reigns cleverness, humour and sometimes agonising choices routinely surprised and always delighted us.
editorialNotes.short: Decide the fate of your kingdom in this exceptionally clever adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love a good Mountain Dewfueled debate over the best way to use Magic Missile, and if youre right there with us, you wont be able to resist this card-based adventure either. The dialogue targets RPG clichs (Rats? How original!) with hilarious sarcasm, but the gameplay is what really grabbed us. Instead of controlling adventurers, you snap cards onto graph paper, building out dungeons that they automatically explore, loot, and die in. (Oops.) We were torn between rooting for them and mischievously seeing how much trouble we could cause

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
